page.title: 07FARMING AND TECHNOLOGY
page.content:
Farming today is an efficiently run business. The type of farming and the landscape in the area lend themselves to mechanisation, so farmers invest heavily in capital equipment - a new combine harvester costs Â£30,000 and may only be used 2 or 3 weeks a year.
The largest farm employs highly trained mechanics to service the machinery. Because of the continual introduction of more modern and expensive equipment the mechanics are sent on Agricultural Training Board refresher courses.
Many farmers have made use of new technology and use computerised farm management systems to deal with every aspect of running the farm including accounting and stock control.
